cui_name: MITOCHONDRIAL COMPLEX I DEFICIENCY, NUCLEAR TYPE 21
reasoning: Mitochondrial Complex I Deficiency due to nuclear gene mutations (Type 21) is an extremely rare genetic disorder. This is a specific genetic subtype among several types. Estimated prevalence <0.05 per 100k based on rarity of reported cases. Confidence very low due to extremely limited epidemiological data and reliance on isolated case reports.
